title: High Coverage of Social Insurance Programs
description: In 2022, 60.23% of Armenia's population was covered by social insurance programs, with the poorest quintile having a slightly higher coverage at 61.64%.

title: Low Incidence of Gift-Giving in Tax Meetings
description: In 2020, only 0.1% of firms in Armenia reported giving gifts during meetings with tax officials, indicating low levels of corruption in tax administration.

title: High Female Representation Among Secondary Education Teachers
description: As of 2023, 88.38% of secondary education teachers in Armenia were female, showcasing gender inclusivity in the education sector.

title: Minimal Energy Depletion Impact on Economy
description: In 2021, energy depletion accounted for a negligible 0.0000000082% of Armenia's GNI, reflecting sustainable energy usage.

title: Low Government Expenditure on Education
description: In 2023, Armenia's government expenditure on education was only 0.24% of GDP, indicating potential underinvestment in the education sector.

title: Low Urban Access to Safely Managed Sanitation Services
description: In 2018, only 0.06% of Armenia's urban population had access to safely managed sanitation services, highlighting a significant public health challenge.

title: Low Belief in Justification of Domestic Violence
description: In 2016, only 0.4% of Armenian women believed a husband is justified in beating his wife for burning food, and 0.8% for refusing sex, reflecting progressive attitudes towards gender equality.
